p: During December 2016 to March 2017, 32 cases of jaundice with features of acute hepatitis were reported in the catchment area of Civil Hospital, sector 45 (CH-45), Chandigarh, India. This number was significantly higher than the numbers (3–5 cases) reported in the last 3 years' reports of integrated disease surveillance project (IDSP) in the same period (2014–16).[ 10] With the team of epidemiologist, virologist, and program officers an AVH outbreak was detected, and an epidemiological investigation was carried out. The objective was to describe its epidemiological features, identify the source of contamination and implement the containment measures in Chandigarh, a North Indian Union Territory.
